intro: Lilaeopsis gunnii, commonly known as the Antarctic hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the cold regions of the Southern Hemisphere. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in low vegetation communities on rocky or sandy soils. The plant has slender, tufted stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that produce numerous tiny flowers. It is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, including strong winds and low temperatures. Lilaeopsis gunnii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
